newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares close mixed, seen fluctuating.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares close mixed, seen fluctuating.

text.p: Leading Russian shares closed mixed on Friday as investors grew disheartened by news that the International Monetary Fund had delayed the release of the next tranche of its $10 billion loan to Moscow, traders said.
Traders forecast market fluctuations in the next few days against a general downward trend.
The Russian Trading System index of 24 shares fell by 3.13 percent to 179.49 on $20.64 million in volume.
Central Bank chairman Sergei Dubinin said he was confident Russia would get all IMF tranches due in 1997 - but the bank said recent talks had not been conclusive and would continue next month.
Andrei Ippolitov, corporate securities director at IK Prospekt, said Dubinin's confidence had not heartened investors.
"So what if he says this -- investors are selling anyway," he said.
He said many short-term investors preferred to sell before President Boris Yeltsin's heart operation, scheduled for mid-November.
Traders gave mixed opinions on the market impact of Moscow telephone company MGTS choosing Salomon Brothers to lead its Eurobond issue.

"This is definitely the type of news investors are very keen on and see in a very positive way -- it will speed the road for other companies to issue Eurobonds," said Victor Pitaleff, a trader at Renaissance Capital.
But Ippolitov said the Eurobond would not help the share as its price per lines ratio was too high.
MGTS, which has not been traded since Monday, rose to $600.0 from $580.0 in late trading.
Investors were not at all encouraged by news that a new Surgutneftegaz share issue acquired by Surgut Holding would not reach the market.
Traders said the fact that Surgut Holding was acquiring the paper had raised questions about corporate governance in Russia and relations between management and shareholders.
Surgutneftegaz was traded at $0.396 after $0.425 at Thursday's close, Mosenergo fell to $0.950 from $0.954, LUKoil edged down to $9.92 from $10.20 and Irkutsnergo rose to $0.106 from $0.10.
